message.content:
To create a regex expression to extract a three character code from a filename in the format "57-1Jn.usfm", you can use the following pattern:

```
^[0-9]+-(?P<code>\w{3})\.usfm$
```

Explanation of the regex expression:
- `^`: asserts position at start of the string
- `[0-9]+`: matches one or more digits (for the number part before the dash)
- `-`: matches a hyphen
- `(?P<code>`: starts a named group for the three character code
- `\w{3}`: matches exactly three word characters (letters, digits, or underscores)
- `)`: ends the named group for the code
- `\.usfm$`: matches the ".usfm" extension at the end of the string

This regex expression will capture the three character code in the named group "code". You can then extract this group from the matched result to obtain the desired code.
